summary: The document, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992 and dated July 4, 1963, details William Pawley's business ventures in the Dominican Republic. These include negotiations for acquiring the Hotel Hamaca in Boca Chica, near a new international airport, and a concession for the procurement and global sale of all new Dominican postage stamps, overseen by his brother Edward Pawley. The document also notes the sensitivity of its source.
key_findings: William Pawley engaged in significant business activities in the Dominican Republic, particularly in the hospitality industry and philately.
Negotiations for the purchase of the Hotel Hamaca in Boca Chica, adjacent to a new international airport, are highlighted.
A concession for the procurement and worldwide sale of new Dominican postage stamps, managed by Edward Pawley, is documented.
The document emphasizes the sensitivity of its source.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
